description: The SportsJS Soccer schema contains properties common to Tennis.

tennisTournamentMetadata.description: For holding metadata having to do with a tennis tournament. Includes an attribute for the name of the tennis tour.

tennisEventMetadata.description: Metadata about the specific tennis match. | When in the match this document was issued.

numberOfSets.description: How many sets the match is played for. Normally 3 or 5.

tennisPlayerStats.description: Holds tennis-specific stats. Used for singles matches. | Generally having to do with the score of the match.

tennisTeamStats.description: Holds tennis-specific stats. Used for doubles matches. | Generally having to do with the score of the match.

tennisStatsSet.description: Holds the score of a set. | Includes an attribute for a set's tiebreaker score.

duration.description: The length in minutes of the set or game where it is inserted.

tennisStatsGame.description: Holds the score of a game. | Also holds details of each point.

duration.description: The length in minutes of the set or game where it is inserted.

baseTennisStats.description: Basic elements and attributes for tennis statistics

tennisStatsService.description: Stats for the play where the player served.

aces.description: How many serve-aces the player shot.

firstServicesGood.description: Number of first serves that were good.

firstServicesGoodPct.description: The percentage of good first serves.

firstServicesPointsWon.description: How many points won after the first serve was good.

firstServicesPointsWonPct.description: Percentage of games won after first serve was good.

secondServicesPointsWon.description: How many points won after the second serve was good.

secondServicesPointsWonPct.description: Percentage of games won after second serve was good.

serviceGamesPlayed.description: How many games in the match or set this player or team served.

serviceGamesWon.description: Number of games won in which the player served.

serviceGamesWonPct.description: The percentage of games won in which the player served.

breakPointsAgainst.description: How many break-points did the other team/player have against the serving player.

breakPointsSaved.description: How many of these break-points were saved by the serving player.

breakPointsSavedPct.description: The percentage of breakpoints saved. (There is some discussion on whether to include all possible break-points or just the deciding ones.)

servePointsPlayed.description: How many points were played with this player/team serving. New attribute and therefore using the more proper term serve instead of service.

servicePointsWon.description: Total points won where the player served. This should be the same as a sum of first-service-points-won and second-service-points-won.

servicePointsWonPct.description: The percentage of points won by the serving player. Should be possible to calculate from other attributes here.

doubleFaults.description: How many double-faults committed by the serving player.

firstServiceTopSpeed.description: The top speed recorded among the serves from this player/team.

firstServeAverageSpeed.description: The average speed recorded among the first serves from this player/team. New attribute and therefore using the more proper term serve instead of service.

secondServicesGood.description: The number of good second serves.

secondServicesGoodPct.description: The percentage of good second serves.

secondServeAverageSpeed.description: The average speed recorded among the second serves from this player/team. New attribute and therefore using the more proper term serve instead of service.

speedUnits.description: The measurement unit used for the various speed attributes. Normally mph, but can be m/s or km/h or something else.

tennisStatsReturn.description: Stats for play where the player is receiving the serve.

returnsPlayed.description: How many points played where this player/team received the serve.

receivePointsWon.description: How many points won by the receiving player. New attribute using the term receive which is preferred to return.

receivePointsWonPct.description: The percentage of points won by the receiving player. New attribute using the term receive which is preferred to return.

firstServiceReturnPointsWon.description: How many points won by the player after receiving the first serve.

firstServiceReturnPointsWonPct.description: The percentage of points won by the player after receiving the first serve.

secondServiceReturnPointsWon.description: How many points won after receiving the second serve.

secondServiceReturnPointsWonPct.description: The percentage of points won after receiving the second serve.

returnGamesPlayed.description: And how does this compare to the returns-played and matches-played above?

returnGamesWon.description: How many games won after receiving the serve.

returnGamesWonPct.description: The percentage of games won after receiving the serve.

breakPointsPlayed.description: How many possible break-points the receiving player/team had.

breakPointsConverted.description: The number of break-points that resulted in actually breaking the serve.

netPointsWon.description: Points won after the player went forward close to the net.

netPointsPlayed.description: Number of points played where the player went forward to the net.

netPointsWonPct.description: Percentage of points won after the player went forward close to the net. Should be possible to calculate from the other net-xxx attributes.

winnersForehand.description: Total number of winning strokes using the forehand.

winnersBackhand.description: Total number of winning strokes using the backhand.

winnersVolley.description: Total number of winning strokes using volley.

unforcedErrors.description: Total number of unforced errors performed.

eventStateTennis.description: A group of attributes (set, game, server, server-score, receiver receiver-score, serve-number) that can be used for tennis actions.

set.description: Which set in the game this item covers. Normally 1,2,3,4 or 5.

game.description: Wich game in the current set this item covers. Generally 1 through 7.

serverIdref.description: A pointer to the player-id or team-id who served the ball on this point.

serverScore.description: The score of the player or team presently serving, either love, 15, 30, 40, game.

receiverIdref.description: A pointer to the player-id or team-id who received the served ball on this point.

receiverScore.description: The score of the player or team presently receiving, either love, 15, 30, 40, game.

serveNumber.description: Identifying either the first or second serve.

tennisGameResult.description: The score of the player or team presently serving, either love, 15, 30, 40, game.
